008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.pub.hough.lines;
010
011import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.util.Locale;
014
015import ij.gui.PolygonRoi;
016import ij.gui.Roi;
017import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
018import imagingbook.pub.geometry.lines.AlgebraicLine;
019import imagingbook.pub.geometry.lines.HessianLine;
020
021/**
022 * This class represents a straight line used in the Hough transform
023 * for straight lines (see {@link imagingbook.pub.hough.HoughTransformLines}).
024 * It inherits from {@link HessianLine} which is, in turn, a subclass of 
025 * {@link AlgebraicLine}.
026 * Unlike a {@link HessianLine} the reference point is not necessarily at
027 * the coordinate origin but is arbitrary.
028 */
029public class HoughLine extends HessianLine implements Comparable<HoughLine> {
030        private final int count;                        // pixel votes for this line
031        private final double xRef, yRef;        // reference point
032        
033        
034        // static factory methods -------------------------------
035        
036        public static HoughLine fromPoints(Point p1, Point p2, Point pRef, int count) {
037                return new HoughLine(AlgebraicLine.fromPoints(p1, p2), pRef.getX(), pRef.getY(), count);
038        }
039        
040        // constructors -----------------------------------------
041
042        /**
043         * Constructor.
044         * @param angle the line's normal angle (see {@link HessianLine})
045         * @param radius the line's radius (distance to reference point)
046         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
047         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
048         * @param count pixel votes for this line
049         */
050        public HoughLine(double angle, double radius, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
051                super(angle, radius);
052                this.xRef = xRef;
053                this.yRef = yRef;
054                this.count = count;
055        }
056        
057        /**
058         * Constructor. 
059         * Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from a given
060         * {@link AlgebraicLine} (or any subclass) instance.
061         * The line parameters are adjusted to the specified reference point
062         * (actually only parameter c is modified, since a change of reference point
063         * effects only a shift of the line).
064         * The two lines are equivalent, i.e., contain the same points (x,y).
065         * Thus the distance from a given point (x,y) is the same from the original
066         * line and the new line.
067         * @param L1 an existing line ({@link AlgebraicLine} or subclass)
068         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
069         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
070         * @param count pixel votes for this line
071         */
072        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine L1, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
073                super(L1.getA(),
074                          L1.getB(),
075                          L1.getC() + L1.getA()*(xRef-L1.getXref()) + L1.getB()*(yRef-L1.getYref())); // = a', b', c'
076                this.xRef = xRef;
077                this.yRef = yRef;
078                this.count = count;
079        }
080        
081        // getter/setter methods ------------------------------------------
082        
083        /**
084         * @return The accumulator count associated with this line.
085         */
086        public int getCount() {
087                return count;
088        }
089        
090        @Override
091        public double getXref() {
092                return xRef;
093        }
094        
095        @Override
096        public double getYref() {
097                return yRef;
098        }
099        
100        // other methods ------------------------------------------
101        
102        /**
103         * Returns the perpendicular distance between this line and the point (x, y).
104         * The result may be positive or negative, depending on which side of the line
105         * (x, y) is located.
106         * 
107         * @param x x-coordinate of point position.
108         * @param y y-coordinate of point position.
109         * @return The perpendicular distance between this line and the point (x, y).
110         */
111        @Override
112        public double getDistance(double x, double y) {
113                return super.getDistance(x - xRef, y - yRef);
114        }
115        
116        @Override
117        public Point getClosestLinePoint(Point p) {
118                double s = 1.0; // 1.0 / (sqr(a) + sqr(b)); // assumed to be normalized
119                double x = p.getX() - xRef;
120                double y = p.getY() - yRef;
121                double x0 = s * (sqr(b) * x - a * b * y - a * c);
122                double y0 = s * (sqr(a) * y - a * b * x - b * c);
123                return Point.create(x0 + xRef, y0 + yRef);
124        }
125        
126        /**
127         * Required by the {@link Comparable} interface, used for sorting lines by their
128         * point count (in descending order, i.e., strong lines come first).
129         * @param other another {@link HoughLine} instance.
130         */
131        @Override
132        public int compareTo(HoughLine other) {
133                return Integer.compare(other.count, this.count);
134        }
135        
136        @Override
137        public String toString() {
138                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <angle = %.3f, radius = %.3f, xRef = %.3f, yRef = %.3f, count = %d>",
139                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getAngle(), getRadius(), getXref(), getYref(), count);
140        }
141        
142        
143        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
144        
145
146        /**
147         * Creates a vector line to be used an element in an ImageJ graphic overlay
148         * (see {@link ij.gui.Overlay}). The length of the displayed line 
149         * is equivalent to the distance of the reference point (typically the
150         * image center) to the coordinate origin.
151         * @return the new line
152         * @deprecated
153         */
154        public PolygonRoi makeLineRoi() {
155                double length = Math.sqrt(xRef * xRef + yRef * yRef);
156                return this.makeLineRoi(length);
157        }
158        
159        /**
160         * Creates a vector line to be used an element in an ImageJ graphic overlay
161         * (see {@link ij.gui.Overlay}). The length of the displayed line 
162         * is measured from its center point (the point closest to the reference
163         * point) in both directions.
164         * 
165         * @param length the length of the line
166         * @return the new line
167         */
168        public PolygonRoi makeLineRoi(double length) {
169                // unit vector perpendicular to the line
170                double dx = Math.cos(angle);    
171                double dy = Math.sin(angle);
172                // calculate the line's center point (closest to the reference point)
173                double x0 = xRef + radius * dx;
174                double y0 = yRef + radius * dy;
175                // calculate the line end points (using normal vectors)
176                float x1 = (float) (x0 + dy * length);
177                float y1 = (float) (y0 - dx * length);
178                float x2 = (float) (x0 - dy * length);
179                float y2 = (float) (y0 + dx * length);
180                float[] xpoints = { x1, x2 };
181                float[] ypoints = { y1, y2 };
182                return new PolygonRoi(xpoints, ypoints, Roi.POLYLINE);
183        }
184
185}
